thread.title: City News: Sainsbury's, HSBC, Bank payout, China trade
thread.title_full: City News: Sainsbury's, HSBC, Bank payout, China trade

title: City News: Sainsbury's, HSBC, Bank payout, China trade
text:
Tesco takes on rivals in new price war - but gives discounters... HSBC looks to the US 
AMERICA has emerged as a potential new home for HSBC as Europe’s biggest bank considers moving its headquarters from the UK and is due to decide by the end of the year. 
Hong Kong, where it was based for over a century, and Singapore have long been considered likely alternatives as HSBC looks to reduce its tax burden. 
But growing concerns about the risk of coming under Chinese regulators are thought to have forced a rethink, with the US seen as being friendlier to big banks. 
Banks to pay £600 m 
BARCLAYS, Royal Bank of Scotland and HSBC have agreed to pay a combined $924million (£604million) to settle claims that they manipulated the $5trillion a day global forex market. Given our in depth knowledge based on our success against the banks in the US, we are gearing up to bring the action to Europe David Scott 
The US settlement of a class action brought against the trio and other banks by law firm Scott & Scott on behalf of companies and pension funds needs final approval from a federal court but could pave the way for similar actions on both sides of the Atlantic. 
Scott’s managing partner David Scott said: “Given our in depth knowledge based on our success against the banks in the US, we are gearing up to bring the action to Europe.” GETTY Barclays, Royal Bank of Scotland and HSBC have agreed to pay a combined $924million (£604million)
